issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

Something to do with the way that the Date object is passed between objective C and JS worlds. If getting that resolved is too much for 0.8.0 (especially because, doh, stupid me, I failed to file a ticket when the functionality was commented out for 0.7.0) could we at least restore the commented out code and get the version of the timedEvent call working where the type Date parameters are null but the duration parameter is used?

{html}
fields.summary: iPhone Analytics: timedEvents don't work if Date is used
